reviewText:
TL;DR Galcon 2 is a high quality, fast paced, indie RTS and it's totally free. No matter if you're looking for something to play for a couple minutes to pass the time, or you want an RTS that you can really dig into and master Galcon 2 is for you.

Actual review: Alright, I may as well throw a review out there for Galcon 2. Long story short I've been playing different versions of Galcon since mid 2008. I've always loved real-time strategy games, and Galcon (being the very core of what makes them great) hooked me instantly. Galcon takes the idea of an RTS and condenses it into it's purist form. No spending the first 5-10 minutes building up your base, scouting the enemy, making sure you build the right units to counter your opponent. You have planets that generate ships, those ships can be sent to attack other planets to generate more ships or left to defend your planets. Now add 8 or so other people and you get an action packed fast paced arcade style RTS.

The game is super easy to learn, there's a tutorial, single-player bots with a wide range of difficulty levels, and even a co-op mode to play with your friends against bots. Once you've got the hang of it, multiplayer is a whole new world. Galcon 2 is the very definition of easy to learn, hard to master.

To top it all off, this version is totally free. The only micro-transactions are cosmetic, running a tournament, or running your own server which you really only need if you want to run mods (did I mention the game is modable?). You don't need to pay a penny to get the full experience, plus you can earn the in-game currency over time (but I'm not going to dive into that system here).

The community around this game is also dedicated and nice, there's always someone willing to help teach you if you'd like to learn more, just visit the forums and ask.

Anyway, I'm absolutely biased, like I said I've been playing versions of this game for 5 or 6 years now. I also currently help moderate the forums, and have admined past versions of the game. But I've only stuck around this long because I really do love the game and it's community.

If you've ever got any questions about the game, want help getting better, or just a friendly face to play some rounds with, feel free to message me (Chi-Ro) on the website and I'll be happy to help!

https://www.galcon.com/forums/msg.php?action=compose

The motion capture graphics are the first thing that struck me when playing this game, absolutely stunning, it is optimized so well almost any computer could easily run it at max settings and maintain 60 fps, it even made me cry a little bit. The spaceships in “Galcon 2” are the most realistic physical depictions of spaceships in a video game to date. The amount of technology available overwhelms the player.

FREE GAME! Honestly, this should be priced at $60, maybe even more.

The combat: It is amazing, you have high-detail next gen spaceships at your disposal, ready to attack enemy planets. There are so many different colors you can be, every time I am a new color, I feel like I am being born again, there is so much variety in the colors and the way they attack.

Multiplayer: With internet getting about 4kb/s, I feared I wouldn't be able to play online, boy was I wrong. For the first time, I was able to play an online game without lag. I played with my friends and we worked together to conquer the planets. There are so many different gamemodes to pick from, I felt overwhelmed.

Soundtrack: The music in this makes me want to get up and dance in the middle of my game. The song is constantly stuck in my head all day, but I actually like having this song in my head.

Extras:
+While playing the game there are neutral planets, all of these have clever, realistic names to them, adding more atmosphere to the game.

+I just can't stop talking about the graphics, I literally fell backwards when I first opened the game, I felt as if I was actually in space.

+Online, with eight people playing simultaneously, it's hard to even put into words. There's just so much happening at once, so fast, without any lag too.

Galcon 2 might be the craziest, most intense video game experience I've had in years, but it's also amazing. With stunning graphics, beautiful music, intense, fast paced battles, and so much variety, I couldn't think of one way to improve this game.

Final Score: 11/10 - Best game I have ever played in my life. Game of the century. I would be shocked if I managed to find a game better than this.

Great strategy game for anyone to play. Steep learning curve in the sense that anyone can play it but if you are new, experienced player will destroy you over and over until you learn how to play well. If you play the bots and beat the highest difficulty bot you will be prepared for multiplayer, but it does have a steep learning curve. If you are up to the challenge this game will test your skills.

There is no progression in this game besides mental progression. You do not unlock or purchase bonuses that help you win games. You may only unlock special effects that have no effect on gameplay. This game has a hardcore playstyle.

There are tournaments to truly test your skill, however I see them being exploited in 1 vs all where the all will usually beat the 1 and since let's say 1v5 happens, if the 5 wins, 5 wins are distributed and 1 loss. They take turns and the overall ranks of the community (Flag color, darker colors being better) will increase due to this exploit. Being said, the true test of this game is your skill. If you learn, you will succeed.

As simple of a game as this seems, this is really a tough game that can be learned and loved.
